intro: Brachiaria xantholeuca, commonly known as yellow leucopodia grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to South America and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and distinctive yellowish-white inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland and marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-green hue, while the stems are erect and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Brachiaria xantholeuca is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and prevent erosion in wetland habitats.
